column5: I had a neighbor send some pictures last night. I hope no one hurt. It's sad that's where I got gas, bait. Very nice couple that ran it. Hope it gets rebuilt but with what's going on I bet it doesn't.
no way! Really hope no one was hurt.
That is unfortunate. I feel bad for the couple who ran it. At least it wasn't a home, just a business...and nobody was hurt.
Dang that's too bad for them. I hope they can rebuild......that is our yearly stop before heading north on 105.
I wonder if we will see any suspect fires based on lack of business n cashing in on insurance like we had in the early 80s with barns being burned on the farms.
Hate to say it but that was my first thought.
It was a real store, run by real people....they would probably appreciate some moral support at this time.
Yes Gord,a very nice young hard working family.

I was not knocking them as in the early 80s around 1/3 of the farms went under in our counties n we were lucky due to several factors. Iâ€™m sure it was an accident n hopefully they had good insurance to rebuild or move on. Our barns never burned but we saw a lot n that held off the auctioneers for some for at least awhile. I hope they open the border so the economy can pick up.
